[She]1187-a tired little english lady , of no importance to look at kept entirely to [herself]1187-a tired little english lady , of no importance to look at , and was thankful for the luxury of loneliness after some overwhelming sorrow . One day [she]1187-a tired little english lady , of no importance to look at was requested to go . [The proprietor of the hotel]1191-the proprietor of the hotel was distressed , but [he]1191-the proprietor of the hotel could not do otherwise than comply with the demands of [[his]1191-the proprietor of the hotel guests]1192-his guests . "[958-one] It is not known who [you]546-you are , [Mademoiselle]76-mademoiselle , " [he]1191-the proprietor of the hotel said . "[546-you] And [you]546-you are not approved of . [You]547-you English are [curious people]548-curious people . But what can [I]0-i do ? [You]546-you have [a cheap room]549-a cheap room , and are [a stranger to [me]0-i]550-a stranger to me . [The others]551-the others have [expensive apartments]552-expensive apartments , and come year after year . [You]546-you see [my]0-i position , [Mademoiselle]76-mademoiselle ? [I]0-i am sorry . " So [the little tired lady]1193-the little tired lady had to go . That was how the story went . It was not known what became of [her]1193-the little tired lady , but it was known that [the English people]503-the english people in [the Kurhaus]7-the kurhaus tried to persuade [her]1193-the little tired lady to come to [them]503-the english people . But [she]1193-the little tired lady had lost heart , and left in distress . This could not have happened in [the Kurhaus]7-the kurhaus , where [all were received on equal terms]1195-all were received on equal terms , [those about whom nothing was known]1196-those about whom nothing was known , and [those about whom too much was known]1197-those about whom too much was known . The strange mixture and the contrasts of character afforded endless scope for observation and amusement , and [Bernardine]31-bernardine , who was daily becoming more interested in [her]31-bernardine surroundings , felt that [she]31-bernardine would have been sorry to have exchanged [[her]31-bernardine present abode]1198-her present abode for [the English quarter]1186-the english quarter . The amusing part of it was that [the English people]503-the english people in [the Kurhaus]7-the kurhaus were regarded by [[their]503-the english people compatriots]1201-their compatriots in [the English quarter]1186-the english quarter as [sheep of the blackest dye]1203-sheep of the blackest dye ! This was all the more ridiculous because with two exceptions — firstly of [Mrs. Reffold]27-mrs. reffold , who took nearly all [her]27-mrs. reffold pleasures with [the American colony in [the Grand Hotel]1205-the grand hotel]1204-the american colony in the grand hotel ; and secondly , of [a Scotch widow who had returned to [Petershof]2-petershof to weep over [[her]1206-a scotch widow who had returned to petershof to weep over her husband 's grave , but put away her grief together with her widow 's weeds husband]379-her husband 's grave , but put away [her]1206-a scotch widow who had returned to petershof to weep over her husband 's grave , but put away her grief together with her widow 's weeds grief together with [[her]1206-a scotch widow who had returned to petershof to weep over her husband 's grave , but put away her grief together with her widow 's weeds widow]1208-her widow 's weeds]1206-a scotch widow who had returned to petershof to weep over her husband 's grave , but put away her grief together with her widow 's weeds , and consoled [herself]1206-a scotch widow who had returned to petershof to weep over her husband 's grave , but put away her grief together with her widow 's weeds with [a Spanish gentleman]1209-a spanish gentleman — with these two exceptions , [the little English community in [the Kurhaus]7-the kurhaus]1210-the little english community in the kurhaus was most humdrum and harmless , being occupied , as in the case of [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man , with cameras and cheese - mites , or in other cases with the still more engrossing pastime of taking care of one 's ill - health , whether real or fancied : but yet , an innocent hobby in itself and giving one absolutely no leisure to do anything worse : a great recommendation for any pastime . This was not [Bernardine]31-bernardine 's occupation : it was difficult to say what [she]31-bernardine did with [herself]31-bernardine , for [she]31-bernardine had not yet followed [Robert Allitsen]40-robert allitsen 's advice and taken up some definite work : and the very fact that [she]31-bernardine had no such wish , pointed probably to a state of health which forbade it . [She]31-bernardine , naturally so keen and hard - working , was content to take what the hour brought , and the hour brought various things : chess with [the Swedish professor]332-the swedish professor , or Russian dominoes with [the shrivelled - up little Polish governess who always tried to cheat , and who clutched [her]1206-a scotch widow who had returned to petershof to weep over her husband 's grave , but put away her grief together with her widow 's weeds tiny winnings with precisely the same greediness shown by [the Monte Carlo female gamblers]1214-the monte carlo female gamblers]1213-the shrivelled - up little polish governess who always tried to cheat , and who clutched her tiny winnings with precisely the same greediness shown by the monte carlo female gamblers . Or the hour brought a stroll with [the French danseuse]1215-the french danseuse and [her]1215-the french danseuse poodle , and a conversation about the mere trivialities of life , which a year or two , or even a few months ago , [Bernardine]31-bernardine would have condemned as beneath contempt , but , which were now taking their rightful place in [her]31-bernardine new standard of importances . For some natures learn with greater difficulty and after greater delay than others , that the real importances of [our]1216-our existence are the nothingnesses of every - day life , the nothingnesses which [the philosopher in [his]1217-the philosopher in his study study]1217-the philosopher in his study , reasoning about and analysing human character , is apt to overlook ; but which , nevertheless , make [him]1217-the philosopher in his study and every one else more of a human reality and less of an abstraction . And [Bernardine]31-bernardine , hitherto occupied with so - called intellectual pursuits , with problems of the study , of no value to [the great world outside the study]1218-the great world outside the study , or with social problems of [the great world]1219-the great world , great movements , and great questions , was now just beginning to appreciate the value of the little incidents of [that same great world]1220-that same great world . Or the hour brought [its]1221-its own thoughts , and [Bernardine]31-bernardine found [herself]31-bernardine constantly thinking of [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man : always in sorrow and always with sympathy , and sometimes with tenderness . When [he]102-the disagreeable man told [her]31-bernardine about the one sacrifice , [she]31-bernardine could have wished to wrap [him]102-the disagreeable man round with love and tenderness . If [he]102-the disagreeable man could only have known it , [he]102-the disagreeable man had never been so near love as then . [She]31-bernardine had suffered so much [herself]31-bernardine , and , with increasing weaknesses , had so wished to put off the burden of the flesh , that [her]31-bernardine whole heart went out to [him]102-the disagreeable man . Would [he]102-the disagreeable man get [his]102-the disagreeable man freedom , [she]31-bernardine wondered , and would [he]102-the disagreeable man use it ? Sometimes when [she]31-bernardine was with [him]102-the disagreeable man , [she]31-bernardine would look up to see whether [she]31-bernardine could read the answer in [his]102-the disagreeable man face ; but [she]31-bernardine never saw any variation of expression there , nothing to give [her]31-bernardine even a suggestion . But this [she]31-bernardine noticed : that there was a marked variation in [his]102-the disagreeable man manner , and that when [he]102-the disagreeable man had been rough in bearing , or bitter in speech , [he]102-the disagreeable man made silent amends at the earliest opportunity by being less rough and less bitter . [She]31-bernardine felt this was no small concession on the part of [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man . [He]102-the disagreeable man was particularly disagreeable on the day when [the Dutchman]519-the dutchman was buried , and so the following day when [Bernardine]31-bernardine met [him]102-the disagreeable man in [the little English library]1225-the little english library , [she]31-bernardine was not surprised to find [him]102-the disagreeable man almost kindly . [He]102-the disagreeable man had chosen the book which [she]31-bernardine wanted , but [he]102-the disagreeable man gave it up to [her]31-bernardine at once without any grumbling , though [Bernardine]31-bernardine expected [him]102-the disagreeable man to change [his]102-the disagreeable man mind before [they]1226-they left [the library]1227-the library . "[0-i] Well , " [he]102-the disagreeable man said , as [they]1226-they walked along together , "[0-i] and have [you]553-you recovered from the death of [the Dutchman]519-the dutchman ? " "[555-you] Have [you]555-you recovered , rather let [me]0-i ask ? " [she]31-bernardine said . "[555-you] [You]555-you were in a horrid mood last night . " "[555-you] [I]0-i was feeling wretchedly ill , " [he]102-the disagreeable man said quietly . That was the first time [he]102-the disagreeable man had ever alluded to [his]102-the disagreeable man own health . "[0-i] Not that there is any need to make an excuse , " [he]102-the disagreeable man continued , "[0-i] for [I]0-i do not recognise that there is any necessity to consult [one]958-one 's surroundings , and alter the inclination of one 's mind accordingly . Still , as a matter of fact , [I]0-i felt very ill ! " "[0-i] And to - day ? " [she]31-bernardine asked . "[0-i] To - day [I]0-i am [myself]0-i again , " [he]102-the disagreeable man answered quickly : "[0-i] that usual normal self of [mine]0-i , whatever that may mean . " "[0-i] Oh , [we]595-we wo n't say anything about that now , " said [Mrs. Reffold]27-mrs. reffold , smiling sweetly . "[595-we] But [I]0-i 've said [I]0-i am sorry , " [he]48-mr. reffold continued . " But [she]31-bernardine could not control [her]31-bernardine feelings , and [she]31-bernardine laughed . The stillness grew oppressive , and [Bernardine]31-bernardine rose . [She]31-bernardine knew from the effort which those few words had cost [her]31-bernardine , how far removed [she]31-bernardine was from [her]31-bernardine old former self . [THE Doctors in [Petershof]2-petershof]1276-the doctors in petershof always said that [the caretakers of [the invalids]1278-the invalids]1277-the caretakers of the invalids were a much greater anxiety than [the invalids]1278-the invalids [themselves]1278-the invalids . [The invalids]1278-the invalids would either get better or die : one of two things probably . At any rate , [you]1281-you knew where [you]1281-you were with [them]1278-the invalids . But not so with [the caretakers]1282-the caretakers : there was nothing [they]1282-the caretakers were not capable of doing — except taking reasonable care of [[their]1282-the caretakers invalids]1283-their invalids ! [They]1282-the caretakers either fussed about too much , or else [they]1282-the caretakers did not fuss about at all . [They]1282-the caretakers all began by doing the right thing : [they]1282-the caretakers all ended by doing the wrong . [The fussy ones]1284-the fussy ones had fits of apathy , when [the poor irritable patients]1285-the poor irritable patients seemed to get a little better ; [the negligent ones]1286-the negligent ones had paroxysms of attentiveness , when [[their]1282-the caretakers invalids]1283-their invalids , accustomed to loneliness and neglect , seemed to become rather worse by being worried . To remonstrate with [the caretakers]1282-the caretakers would have been folly : for [they]1282-the caretakers were well satisfied with [their]1282-the caretakers own methods . To contrive [their]1282-the caretakers departure would have been an impossibility : for [they]1282-the caretakers were firmly convinced that [their]1282-the caretakers presence was necessary to the welfare of [their]1282-the caretakers charges . And then , too , judging from the way in which [they]1282-the caretakers managed to amuse [themselves]1282-the caretakers , [they]1282-the caretakers liked being in [Petershof]2-petershof , though [they]1282-the caretakers never owned that to [the invalids]1278-the invalids . On the contrary , it was the custom for [the caretakers]1282-the caretakers to depreciate [the place]944-the place , and to deplore the necessity which obliged [them]1282-the caretakers to continue [there]141-there month after month . [They]1282-the caretakers were fond , too , of talking about the sacrifices which [they]1282-the caretakers made , and the pleasures which [they]1282-the caretakers willingly gave up in order to stay with [[their]1282-the caretakers invalids]1283-their invalids . [They]1282-the caretakers said this in the presence of [[their]1282-the caretakers invalids]1283-their invalids . And if [the latter]1295-the latter had told [them]1282-the caretakers by all means to pack up and go back to the pleasures which [they]1282-the caretakers had renounced , [they]1282-the caretakers would have been astonished at the ingratitude which could suggest the idea . [They]1282-the caretakers were amusing characters , [these caretakers]1296-these caretakers . [They]1282-the caretakers were so thoroughly unconscious of [their]1282-the caretakers own deficiencies . [They]1282-the caretakers might neglect [[their]1282-the caretakers own invalids]1297-their own invalids , but [they]1282-the caretakers would look after [[other people]150-other people 's invalids]1299-other people 's invalids , and play [the nurse]351-the nurse most soothingly and prettily where there was no call and no occasion . Then [they]1282-the caretakers would come and relate to [[their]1282-the caretakers neglected dear ones]1301-their neglected dear ones what [they]1282-the caretakers had been doing for [others]939-others : and [the dear ones]1303-the dear ones would smile quietly , and watch the buttons being stitched on for [strangers]366-strangers , and the cornflour which [they]1282-the caretakers could not get nicely made for [themselves]1282-the caretakers , being carefully prepared for [[other people]150-other people 's neglected dear ones]1306-other people 's neglected dear ones . [Some of [the dear ones]1303-the dear ones]1307-some of the dear ones were rather bitter . But there were [many of a higher order of intelligence]1309-many of a higher order of intelligence , who seemed to realize that [they]1309-many of a higher order of intelligence had no right to be ill , and that being ill , and therefore a burden on [[their]1309-many of a higher order of intelligence friends]1310-their friends , [they]1309-many of a higher order of intelligence must make the best of everything , and be grateful for what was given [them]1309-many of a higher order of intelligence , and patient when anything was withheld . [Others of a still higher order of understanding]1311-others of a still higher order of understanding , attributed the eccentricities of [the caretakers]1282-the caretakers to one cause alone : the [Petershof]2-petershof air . [They]1311-others of a still higher order of understanding know it had the invariable effect of getting into the head , and upsetting the balance of [those who drank deep of it]1313-those who drank deep of it . Therefore [no one]157-no one was to blame , and [no one]157-no one need be bitter . But these were [the philosophers of [the colony]1317-the colony]1316-the philosophers of the colony : [a select and dainty few in [any colony]1319-any colony]1318-a select and dainty few in any colony . But there were [several rebels amongst [the invalids]1278-the invalids]1320-several rebels amongst the invalids , and [they]1320-several rebels amongst the invalids found consolation in confiding to [each other]167-each other [their]1320-several rebels amongst the invalids separate grievances . [They]1320-several rebels amongst the invalids generally held [their]1320-several rebels amongst the invalids conferences in [the rooms known as the newspaper - rooms]1323-the rooms known as the newspaper - rooms , where [they]1320-several rebels amongst the invalids were not likely to be interrupted by [any caretakers who might have stayed at [home]119-home because [they]1324-any caretakers who might have stayed at home because they were tired out were tired out]1324-any caretakers who might have stayed at home because they were tired out . To - day there were only [a few rebels gathered together]1326-a few rebels gathered together , but [they]1326-a few rebels gathered together were more than usually excited , because [the Doctors]152-the doctors had told several of [them]1326-a few rebels gathered together that [[their]1326-a few rebels gathered together respective caretakers]1328-their respective caretakers must be sent [home]119-home . So [you]624-you see , [Mademoiselle Gerardy]76-mademoiselle , that [I]0-i , too , am in a bad plight . What am [I]0-i to do ? " Then [a young American]1331-a young american spoke . [He]498-the doctor had been getting gradually worse since [he]498-the doctor came to [Petershof]2-petershof , but [[his]498-the doctor brother]1332-his brother , [a bright sturdy young fellow]1333-a bright sturdy young fellow , seemed quite unconscious of the seriousness of [his]498-the doctor condition . "[0-i] And what am [I]0-i to do ? " [he]498-the doctor asked pathetically . "[0-i] [[My]0-i brother]625-my brother does not even think [I]0-i am ill . Then [I]0-i tell [him]625-my brother that [the Doctor]498-the doctor says [I]0-i must lie quietly in the sun . [I]0-i have [no one]157-no one to take care of [me]0-i , so [I]0-i try to take a little care of [myself]0-i , and then [I]0-i am laughed at . " [His]625-my brother cheeks were sunken , [his]625-my brother eyes were leaden . There was no power in [his]625-my brother voice , no vigour in [his]625-my brother frame . "[630-they] [I]0-i do n't know whether [I]0-i am much better off than [you]631-you , " said [an English lady]1335-an english lady , [Mrs. Bridgetower]81-mrs. bridgetower . "[0-i] [I]0-i certainly have [a trained nurse]345-a trained nurse to look after [me]0-i , but [she]345-a trained nurse is altogether too much for [me]0-i , and [she]345-a trained nurse does just as [she]345-a trained nurse pleases . [She]345-a trained nurse is always ailing , or else pretends to be ; and [she]345-a trained nurse is always depressed . [She]345-a trained nurse grumbles from eight in the morning till nine at night . [I]0-i have heard that [she]345-a trained nurse is cheerful with [other people]150-other people , but [she]345-a trained nurse never gives [me]0-i the benefit of [her]345-a trained nurse brightness . Poor thing ! [She]345-a trained nurse does feel the cold very much , but it is not very cheering to see [her]345-a trained nurse crouching near the stove , with [her]345-a trained nurse arms almost clasping it ! When [she]345-a trained nurse is not talking of [her]345-a trained nurse own looks , all [she]345-a trained nurse says is : ' Oh , if [I]0-i had only not come to [Petershof]2-petershof ! ' or , ' Why did [I]0-i ever leave [that hospital]634-that hospital in [Manchester]20-manchester ? ' or , ' The cold is eating into the very marrow of [my]0-i bones . " "[0-i] [I]0-i would give a good deal to have [a sister]637-a sister like [pretty Fräulein Müller]47-fräulein has , " said [little Fräulein Oberhof]83-little fräulein oberhof . "[637-a sister] [She]637-a sister came to look after [me]0-i the other day when [I]0-i was alone . [She]637-a sister has the kindest way about [her]637-a sister . But when [[my]0-i sister]612-my sister came in , [she]637-a sister was not pleased to find [Fräulein Sophie Müller]47-fräulein with [me]0-i . [She]637-a sister does not do anything for [me]0-i [herself]637-a sister , and [she]637-a sister does not like [any one else]995-any one else to do anything either . Still , [she]637-a sister is very good to [other people]150-other people . [She]637-a sister comes up from [the theatre]641-the theatre sometimes at half - past nine — that is the hour when [I]0-i am just sleepy — and [she]637-a sister stamps about [the room]389-the room , and makes cornflour for [the old Polish lady]643-the old polish lady . Then off [she]637-a sister goes , taking with [her]637-a sister the cornflour together with [my]0-i sleep . Once [I]0-i complained , but [she]643-the old polish lady said [I]0-i was irritable . [You]644-you ca n't think how teasing it is to hear the noise of the spoon stirring the cornflour just when [you]644-you are feeling drowsy . [You]644-you say to [yourself]644-you , ' Will that cornflour never be made ? It seems to take centuries . ' " "[958-one] [One]958-one could be more patient if it were being made for [oneself]958-one , " said [M. Lichinsky]80-m. lichinsky . "[958-one] But at least , [Fräulein]47-fräulein , [[your]47-fräulein sister]646-your sister does not quarrel with [every one]231-every one . [You]47-fräulein must be grateful for that mercy ! " Even as [he]80-m. lichinsky spoke , [a stout lady]1336-a stout lady thrust [herself]1336-a stout lady into [the reading - room]1337-the reading - room . [She]1336-a stout lady looked very hot and excited . [She]1336-a stout lady was [[M. Lichinsky]80-m. lichinsky 's mother]1338-m. lichinsky 's mother . [She]1336-a stout lady spoke with a whirlwind of Polish words . It is sometimes difficult to know when [these people]1339-these people are angry and when [they]1339-these people are pleased . But there was no mistake about [Mme . Lichinsky]84-mme . lichinsky . [She]1336-a stout lady was always angry . [[Her]1336-a stout lady son]1340-her son rose from the sofa and followed [her]1336-a stout lady to the door . Then [he]1340-her son turned round to [[his]1340-her son confederates]1341-his confederates , and shrugged [his]1340-her son shoulders . "[47-fräulein] Another quarrel ! " [he]1340-her son said hopelessly . "[648-you] [YOU]648-you may have talent for other things , " [Robert Allitsen]40-robert allitsen said one day to [Bernardine]31-bernardine , "[648-you] but [you]648-you certainly have no talent for photography . [You]648-you have not made the slightest progress . " "[648-you] [I]0-i do n't at all agree with [you]649-he , " [Bernardine]31-bernardine answered rather peevishly . "[0-i] [I]0-i think [I]0-i am getting on very well . " "[648-you] [You]648-you are [no judge]650-no judge , " [he]649-he said . "[648-you] To begin with , [you]648-you can not focus properly . Well , [she]651-she may be one for all [I]0-i know , but in real life [she]651-she has not the appearance of one . " [She]31-bernardine flushed crimson with temper . "[651-she] Nothing is easier than to make fun of [others]939-others , " [she]31-bernardine said fiercely . "[651-she] It is the resource of [the ignorant]653-the ignorant . " Then , after the fashion of [angry women]1342-angry women , having said [her]31-bernardine say , [she]31-bernardine stalked away . If there had been a door to bang , [she]31-bernardine would certainly have banged it . Then [he]102-the disagreeable man put on a black coat and a white silk tie . There was a speck of dust on the coat . [He]102-the disagreeable man carefully removed that , and then extinguished the lamp . On [his]102-the disagreeable man way [downstairs]1350-downstairs [he]102-the disagreeable man met [Marie]39-marie , who gazed at [him]102-the disagreeable man in astonishment . [The Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man meanwhile had reached [the Concert Hall]1353-the concert hall . [He]102-the disagreeable man glanced around , and saw where [Bernardine]31-bernardine was sitting , and then chose a place in the opposite direction , quite by [himself]102-the disagreeable man . [He]102-the disagreeable man looked somewhat like a dog who has been well beaten . Now and again [he]102-the disagreeable man looked up to see whether [she]31-bernardine still kept [her]31-bernardine seat . The bad music was a great irritation to [him]102-the disagreeable man . But [he]102-the disagreeable man stayed on heroically . There was no reason why [he]102-the disagreeable man should stay . Gradually , too , [the audience]1354-the audience began to thin . Still [he]102-the disagreeable man lingered , always looking like a dog in punishment . At last [Bernardine]31-bernardine rose , and [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man rose too . [He]102-the disagreeable man followed [her]31-bernardine humbly to the door . [She]31-bernardine turned and saw [him]102-the disagreeable man . "[0-i] [I]0-i am sorry [I]0-i put [you]655-you in a bad temper , " [he]102-the disagreeable man said . "[0-i] It was stupid of [me]0-i . " [They]1358-they both laughed , and the good understanding between [them]1358-they was cemented again . "[655-you] [You]655-you are certainly getting better , " [he]1357-he said suddenly . [You]655-you will write [your]655-you book . " [Bernardine]31-bernardine shook [her]31-bernardine head . "[655-you] [I]0-i do n't seem to care now , " [she]31-bernardine said . "[655-you] Now listen to [me]0-i . Whatever else [you]655-you may do , do n't make [[your]655-you characters]657-your characters hold long discussions with [each other]167-each other . It is only the stupid who think [they]661-clever people must talk cleverly all the time . And do n't detain [[your]655-you reader]662-your reader too long : if [you]655-you must have a sunset , let it be a short one . " [She]0-i left [him]1384-he to [his]1384-he work , and went away , thinking . All the time [she]0-i had now been in [Petershof]2-petershof had not sufficed to make [her]0-i indifferent to the sadness of [her]0-i surroundings . In vain [the Disagreeable Man]28-the disagreeable man 's preachings , in vain [her]0-i own reasonings with [herself]0-i . [These people here who suffered , and faded , and passed away , who were [they]1385-these people here who suffered , and faded , and passed away , who were they to her to [her]0-i]1385-these people here who suffered , and faded , and passed away , who were they to her ? Why should the faintest shadow steal across [her]0-i soul on account of [them]1385-these people here who suffered , and faded , and passed away , who were they to her ? There was no reason . And still [she]0-i felt for [them]1385-these people here who suffered , and faded , and passed away , who were they to her all , [she]0-i who in the old days would have thought it waste of time to spare a moment 's reflection on anything so unimportant as the sufferings of [an individual human being]1386-an individual human being . And the bridge between [her]0-i former and [[her]0-i present self]1387-her present self was [her]0-i own illness . [What dull - minded sheep [we]1389-we must all be]1388-what dull - minded sheep we must all be , how lacking in the very elements of imagination , since [we]1389-we are only able to learn by personal experience of grief and suffering , something about the suffering and grief of [others]939-others ! Yea , how the dogs must wonder at [us]1389-we : those dogs who know when [we]1389-we are in pain or trouble , and nestle nearer to [us]1389-we . So [Bernardine]31-bernardine reached [her]31-bernardine own door . [She]31-bernardine heard [her]31-bernardine name called , and , turning round , saw [Mrs. Reffold]27-mrs. reffold . There was a scared look on the beautiful face . "[35-miss holme] [Miss Holme]35-miss holme , " [she]0-i said , "[35-miss holme] [I]0-i have been sent for — [I]0-i dare n't go to [him]692-him alone — [I]0-i want [you]35-miss holme — [he]692-him is worse . [I]0-i am " . . . . [Bernardine]31-bernardine took [her]31-bernardine hand , and [the two women]1391-the two women hurried away in silence . [BERNARDINE]31-bernardine had seen [Mr. Reffold]48-mr. reffold the previous day . [She]31-bernardine had sat by [his]48-mr. reffold side and held [his]48-mr. reffold hand . [He]48-mr. reffold had smiled at [her]31-bernardine many times , but [he]48-mr. reffold only spoke once . "[0-i] [Little Brick]53-little brick , " [he]48-mr. reffold whispered — for [his]48-mr. reffold voice had become nothing but a whisper . "[53-little brick] [I]0-i remember all [you]35-miss holme told [me]0-i . [God]44-god bless [you]35-miss holme . But what a long time it does take to die . " But that was yesterday . [The lane]1392-the lane had come to an ending at last , and [Mr. Reffold]48-mr. reffold lay dead . [They]1393-they bore [him]48-mr. reffold to [the little mortuary chapel]1394-the little mortuary chapel . And [Bernardine]31-bernardine stayed with [Mrs. Reffold]27-mrs. reffold , who seemed afraid to be alone . [She]27-mrs. reffold clung to [Bernardine]31-bernardine 's hand . "[44-god] No , no , " [she]0-i said excitedly , "[44-god] [you]35-miss holme must not go ! [I]0-i ca n't bear to be alone : [you]35-miss holme must stay with [me]0-i ! " [She]0-i expressed no sorrow , no regret . [She]0-i did not even speak [his]48-mr. reffold name . [She]0-i just sat nursing [her]0-i beautiful face . Once or twice [Bernardine]31-bernardine tried to slip away . This waiting about was a strain on [her]31-bernardine , and [she]31-bernardine felt that [she]31-bernardine was doing no good . But each time [Mrs. Reffold]27-mrs. reffold looked up and prevented [her]31-bernardine . "[0-i] No , no , " [she]0-i said . "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't bear [myself]0-i without [you]35-miss holme . [I]0-i must have [you]35-miss holme near [me]0-i . Why should [you]35-miss holme leave [me]0-i ? " So [Bernardine]31-bernardine lingered . [She]31-bernardine tried to read a book which lay on the table . [She]31-bernardine counted the lines and dots on the wall - paper . [She]31-bernardine thought about [the dead man]1395-the dead man ; and about [the living woman]1396-the living woman . [She]31-bernardine had pitied [him]1395-the dead man ; but when [she]31-bernardine looked at the stricken face of [[his]1395-the dead man wife]120-his wife , [Bernardine]31-bernardine 's whole heart rose up in pity for [her]31-bernardine . Remorse would come , although it might not remain long . [The soul]1398-the soul would see [itself]1398-the soul face to face for one brief moment ; and then forget its own likeness . But for the moment — what a weight of suffering , what a whole century of agony ! [Bernardine]31-bernardine grew very tender for [Mrs. Reffold]27-mrs. reffold : [she]31-bernardine bent over the sofa , and fondled the beautiful face . "[35-miss holme] [Mrs. Reffold]27-mrs. reffold " . . . [she]31-bernardine whispered . That was all [she]27-mrs. reffold said : but it was enough . [Mrs. Reffold]27-mrs. reffold burst into an agony of tears . "[27-mrs. reffold] Oh , [Miss Holme]35-miss holme , " [she]0-i sobbed , "[35-miss holme] and [I]0-i was not even kind to [him]693-him ! And now it is too late . How can [I]0-i ever bear [myself]0-i ? " And then it was that [the soul]1398-the soul knew [its]1398-the soul own remorse . [SHE]27-mrs. reffold had left [him]693-him alone and neglected for whole hours when [he]693-him was alive . And now when [he]693-him was dead , and it probably mattered little to [him]693-him where [he]693-him was laid , it was some time before [she]27-mrs. reffold could make up [her]27-mrs. reffold mind to leave [him]693-him in [the lonely little Petershof cemetery]1400-the lonely little petershof cemetery . "[0-i] It will be so dreary for [him]693-him [there]141-there , " [she]27-mrs. reffold said to [the Doctor]498-the doctor . "[0-i] Not so dreary as [you]0-i made it for [him]693-him here , " thought [the Doctor]498-the doctor . But [he]498-the doctor did not say that : [he]498-the doctor just urged [her]27-mrs. reffold quietly to have [[her]27-mrs. reffold husband]379-her husband buried in [Petershof]2-petershof ; and [she]27-mrs. reffold yielded . So [they]1404-they laid [him]693-him to rest in [the dreary cemetery]1405-the dreary cemetery . [Bernardine]31-bernardine went to the funeral , much against [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man 's wish . "[0-i] [You]0-i are looking like a ghost [yourself]0-i , " [he]498-the doctor said to [her]0-i . "[0-i] Come out with [me]0-i into [the country]391-the country instead . " But [she]0-i shook [her]0-i head . "[0-i] Another day , " [she]0-i said . "[0-i] And [Mrs. Reffold]27-mrs. reffold wants [me]0-i . [I]0-i ca n't leave [her]27-mrs. reffold alone , for [she]27-mrs. reffold is so miserable . " [The Disagreeable Man]28-the disagreeable man shrugged [his]28-the disagreeable man shoulders , and went off by [himself]28-the disagreeable man . [Mrs. Reffold]27-mrs. reffold clung very much to [Bernardine]31-bernardine those last days before [she]27-mrs. reffold left [Petershof]2-petershof . [She]0-i had decided to go to [Wiesbaden]21-wiesbaden , where [she]0-i had relations ; and [she]0-i invited [Bernardine]31-bernardine to go with [her]0-i : it was more than that , [she]0-i almost begged [her]0-i . [Bernardine]31-bernardine refused . "[27-mrs. reffold] [I]0-i have been from [England]18-england nearly five months , " [she]0-i said , "[0-i] and [my]0-i money is coming to an end . [I]0-i must go back and work . " "[0-i] Then come away with [me]0-i as [[my]0-i companion]696-my companion , " [Mrs. Reffold]27-mrs. reffold suggested . "[0-i] And [I]0-i will pay [you]0-i a handsome salary . " [Bernardine]31-bernardine could not be persuaded . "[0-i] No , " [she]0-i said . "[0-i] [I]0-i could not earn money that way : it would not suit [me]0-i . And besides , [you]0-i would not care to be a long time with [me]0-i : [you]0-i would soon tire of [me]0-i . [You]0-i think [you]0-i would like to have [me]0-i with [you]0-i now . But [I]0-i know how it would be : [You]0-i would be sorry , and so should [I.]0-i So let [us]697-we part as [we]697-we are now : [you]0-i going [your]0-i way , and [I]0-i going [mine]0-i . [We]697-we live in [different worlds]698-different worlds , [Mrs. Reffold]27-mrs. reffold . It would be as senseless for [me]0-i to venture into [yours]0-i , as for [you]0-i to come into [mine]0-i . Do [you]0-i think [I]0-i am unkind ? " So [they]697-we parted . [Mrs. Reffold]27-mrs. reffold had spoken no word of affection to [Bernardine]31-bernardine , but at [the station]1407-the station , as [she]0-i bent down to kiss [her]31-bernardine , [she]0-i whispered : "[0-i] [I]0-i know [you]0-i will not think too hardly of [me]0-i . Still , will [you]0-i promise [me]0-i ? And if [you]0-i are ever in trouble , and [I]0-i can help [you]0-i , will [you]0-i write to [me]0-i ? " And [Bernardine]31-bernardine promised . When [she]31-bernardine got back to [[her]31-bernardine room]462-her room , [she]31-bernardine found a small packet on [her]31-bernardine table . It contained [Mr. Reffold]48-mr. reffold 's watch - chain . [She]31-bernardine had so often seen [him]48-mr. reffold playing with it . There was a little piece of paper enclosed with it , and [Mr. Reffold]48-mr. reffold had written on it some two months ago : "[0-i] Give [my]0-i watch- chain to [Little Brick]53-little brick , if [she]699-she will sacrifice a little of [her]699-she pride , and accept the gift . " [Bernardine]31-bernardine unfastened [her]31-bernardine watch from the black hair cord , and attached it instead to [Mr. Reffold]48-mr. reffold 's massive gold chain . As [she]31-bernardine sat there fiddling with it , the idea seized [her]31-bernardine that [she]31-bernardine would be all the better for a day 's outing . At first [she]31-bernardine thought [she]31-bernardine would go alone , and then [she]31-bernardine decided to ask [Robert Allitsen]40-robert allitsen . [She]31-bernardine learnt from [Marie]39-marie that [he]40-robert allitsen was in [the dark room]1409-the dark room , and [she]31-bernardine hastened down . [She]31-bernardine knocked several times before there was any answer . "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't be disturbed just now , " [he]40-robert allitsen said . "[0-i] Who is it ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't shout to [you]0-i , " [she]31-bernardine said . [The Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man opened the door of [the dark room]1409-the dark room . "[0-i] [My]0-i negatives will be spoilt , " [he]40-robert allitsen said gruffly . Then seeing [Bernardine]31-bernardine standing there , [he]40-robert allitsen added : "[0-i] Why , [you]0-i look as though [you]0-i wanted some brandy . " "[0-i] No , " [she]31-bernardine said , smiling at [his]40-robert allitsen sudden change of manner . "[0-i] [I]0-i want fresh air , a sledge drive , and a day 's outing . Will [you]0-i come ? " [He]40-robert allitsen made no answer , and retired once more into [the dark room]1409-the dark room . Then [he]40-robert allitsen came out with [his]40-robert allitsen camera . "[0-i] [We]700-we will go to [that inn]701-that inn again , " [he]40-robert allitsen said cheerily . "[0-i] [I]0-i want to take the photographs to [those peasants]702-those peasants . " In half an hours time [they]700-we were on [their]700-we way . It was the same drive as before : and since then , [Bernardine]31-bernardine had seen [more of [the country]391-the country]1413-more of the country , and was more accustomed to the wonderful white scenery : but still the "[702-those peasants] white presences " awed [her]31-bernardine , and still the deep silence held [her]31-bernardine . It was the same scene , and yet not the same either , for the season was now far advanced , and the melting of the snows had begun . In the far distance the whiteness seemed as before ; but on [the slopes near at hand]1415-the slopes near at hand , [the green]1416-the green was beginning to assert itself , and some of the great trees had cast off [their]1417-their heavy burdens , and appeared more gloomy in [their]1417-their freedom than in the days of [their]1417-their snow - bondage . [The roads]1418-the roads were no longer quite so even as before ; [the sledge]407-the sledge glided along when it could , and bumped along when it must . Still , there was sufficient snow left to make the drive possible , and even pleasant . [The two companions]1420-the two companions were quiet . Once only [the Disagreeable Man]28-the disagreeable man made a remark , and then [he]28-the disagreeable man said : "[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid [my]0-i negatives will be spoilt ! " "[0-i] [You]0-i said that before , " [Bernardine]31-bernardine remarked . "[0-i] Well , [I]0-i say it again , " [he]28-the disagreeable man answered in [his]28-the disagreeable man grim way . Then came a long pause . "[0-i] The best part of the winter is over , " [he]28-the disagreeable man said . "[0-i] [We]703-we may have some more snow ; but it is more probable that [we]703-we shall not . It is not enjoyable being here during the melting time . " "[0-i] Well , in any case [I]0-i should not be [here]943-here much longer , " [she]31-bernardine said ; "[0-i] and for a simple reason , too . [I]0-i have nearly come to the end of [my]0-i money . [I]0-i shall have to go back and set to work again . [I]0-i should not have been able to give [myself]0-i this chance , but that [[my]0-i uncle]993-my uncle spared [me]0-i some of [his]993-my uncle money , to which [I]0-i added [my]0-i savings . " "[993-my uncle] Are [you]0-i badly off ? " [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man asked rather timidly . "[0-i] [I]0-i have very few wants , " [she]0-i answered brightly . "[0-i] And wealth is only a relative word , after all . " "[0-i] It is a pity that [you]0-i should go back to work so soon , " [he]102-the disagreeable man said half to [himself]102-the disagreeable man . "[0-i] [You]0-i are only just better ; and it is easy to lose what [one]958-one has gained . " "[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i am not likely to lose , " [she]0-i answered ; "[0-i] but [I]0-i shall be careful this time . [I]0-i shall do a little teaching , and perhaps a little writing : not much — [you]0-i need not be vexed . [I]0-i shall not try to pick up the other threads yet . [I]0-i shall not be political , nor educational , nor anything else great . " "[0-i] If [you]0-i call politics or education great , " [he]102-the disagreeable man said . [Bernardine]31-bernardine did not notice : [she]0-i was on a subject which always excited [her]0-i . [The writers who rail against [the women of this date]714-the women of this date]713-the writers who rail against the women of this date are really describing [the women of ten years ago]715-the women of ten years ago . Why , [the Girton girl of ten years ago]716-the girton girl of ten years ago seems a different creation from [the Girton girl of to - day]717-the girton girl of to - day . Yet the latter has been the steady outgrowth of the former ! " "[718-them] And the difference between [them]718-them ? " "[716-the girton girl of ten years ago] [The Girton girl of ten years ago]716-the girton girl of ten years ago , " said [Bernardine]31-bernardine , "[716-the girton girl of ten years ago] was [a , sombre , spectacled person , carelessly and dowdily dressed , who gave [herself]716-the girton girl of ten years ago up to wisdom , and despised every one who did not know [the Agamemnon]87-the agamemnon]720-a , sombre , spectacled person , carelessly and dowdily dressed , who gave herself up to wisdom , and despised every one who did not know the agamemnon by heart . " And that was the end of the matter , for the word spread about that [Herr Allitsen]58-herr allitsen had arrived , and [every one]231-every one turned out to give [the two guests]1426-the two guests greeting . Ach , [I]0-i am sure of it . " But [Bernardine]31-bernardine smiled and shook [her]31-bernardine head , and went to greet [the others who crowded round [them]1426-the two guests]1427-the others who crowded round them ; and at last [poor Catharina]59-catharina drew near too , holding [Bernardine]31-bernardine 's hand lovingly within [her]59-catharina own . And [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man , much to [Bernardine]31-bernardine 's amazement , drew from [his]102-the disagreeable man pocket a small parcel , which [he]102-the disagreeable man confided to [Liza]56-liza 's care . [Every one]231-every one pressed round [her]56-liza while [she]56-liza opened it , and found what [she]56-liza had so often wished for , a silver watch and chain . "[0-i] Ach , " [she]56-liza cried , "[0-i] how heavenly ! How [all [the girls]730-the girls [here]943-here]729-all the girls here will envy [me]0-i ! How angry [[my]0-i dear friend]732-my dear friend [Susanna]88-susanna will be ! " Then there were the photographs to be examined . [Liza]56-liza looked with stubborn disapproval on the pictures of [herself]56-liza in [her]56-liza working - dress . " [The Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man grunted , but behaved after the fashion of [a hero]1434-a hero , claiming , however , a little silent sympathy from [Bernardine]31-bernardine . It was a pleasant , homely scene : and [Bernardine]31-bernardine , who , felt quite at [her]31-bernardine ease amongst [these people]1339-these people , chatted away with [them]1339-these people as though [she]31-bernardine had known [them]1339-these people all [her]31-bernardine life . Then [Frau Steinhart]67-frau steinhart suddenly remembered that [[her]67-frau steinhart guests]1436-her guests needed some food , and [Liza]56-liza was despatched to [her]56-liza duties as [cook]1437-cook ; though it was some time before [she]56-liza could be induced to leave off looking at the photographs . "[88-susanna] Take them with [you]733-you , [Liza]56-liza , " said [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man . "[733-you] Then [we]734-we shall get [our]734-we meal all the quicker ! " [She]56-liza ran off laughing , and finally [Bernardine]31-bernardine found [herself]31-bernardine alone with [Catharina]59-catharina . "[56-liza] [Liza]56-liza is very happy , " [she]56-liza said to [Bernardine]31-bernardine . "[735-she] [She]735-she loves , and is loved . " "[735-she] That is the greatest happiness , " [Bernardine]31-bernardine said half to [herself]31-bernardine . "[39-marie] [Fräulein]39-marie knows ? " [Catharina]59-catharina asked eagerly . [Bernardine]31-bernardine looked wistfully at [[her]31-bernardine companion]412-her companion . "[39-marie] No , [Catharina]59-catharina , " [she]0-i said . "[39-marie] [I]0-i have only heard and read and seen . " "[39-marie] Then [you]59-catharina can not understand , " [Catharina]59-catharina said almost proudly . "[59-catharina] But [I]0-i understand ! " [She]59-catharina spoke no more after that , but took up [her]59-catharina knitting , and watched [Bernardine]31-bernardine playing with the kittens . [She]31-bernardine was playing with the kittens , and [she]31-bernardine was thinking ; and all the time [she]31-bernardine felt conscious that [this peasant woman]1440-this peasant woman , stricken in mind and body , was pitying [her]31-bernardine because that great happiness of loving and being loved had not come into [her]31-bernardine life . It had seemed something apart from [her]31-bernardine ; [she]31-bernardine had never even wanted it . [She]31-bernardine had wished to stand alone , like a little rock out at [sea]1441-sea . And now ? In a few minutes [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man and [she]31-bernardine sat down to [their]1443-their meal . In spite of [her]31-bernardine excitement , [Liza]56-liza managed to prepare everything nicely ; though when [she]31-bernardine was making the omelette aux fines herbes , [she]31-bernardine had to be kept guarded lest [she]31-bernardine might run off to have another look at the silver watch and the photographs of [herself]31-bernardine in [her]31-bernardine finest frock ! Then [Bernardine]31-bernardine and [Robert Allitsen]40-robert allitsen drank to the health of [Hans]61-hans and [Liza]56-liza : and then came the time of reckoning . When [he]736-he was paying the bill , [Frau Steinhart]67-frau steinhart , having given [him]736-he the change , said coaxingly : "[0-i] Last time , [you]736-he and [Fräulein]39-marie each paid a share : to - day [you]736-he pay all . Then perhaps [you]736-he are betrothed at last , [dear Herr Allitsen]58-herr allitsen ? Ach , how [the old Hausfrau]737-the old hausfrau wishes [you]736-he happiness ! Who deserves to be happy , if it is not [[our]738-our dear [Herr Allitsen]58-herr allitsen]739-our dear herr allitsen ? " "[736-he] [You]736-he have given [me]0-i twenty centimes too much , " [he]736-he said quietly . "[736-he] [You]736-he have [your]736-he head so full of other things that [you]736-he can not reckon properly . " But seeing that [she]740-good little old housemother looked troubled lest [she]740-good little old housemother might have offended [him]736-he , [he]736-he added quickly : "[736-he] When [I]0-i am betrothed , [good little old housemother]740-good little old housemother , [you]740-good little old housemother shall be the first to know . " And [she]740-good little old housemother had to be content with that . [She]740-good little old housemother asked no more questions of either of [them]738-our : but [she]740-good little old housemother was terribly disappointed . There was something a little comical in [her]740-good little old housemother disappointment ; but [Robert Allitsen]40-robert allitsen was not amused at it , as [he]40-robert allitsen had been on a former occasion . As [he]736-he leaned back in [the sledge]407-the sledge , with [the same girl for [[his]736-he companion]492-his companion]1445-the same girl for his companion , [he]736-he recalled [his]736-he feelings . [He]736-he had been astonished and amused , and perhaps a little shy , and a great deal relieved that [she]740-good little old housemother had been sensible enough to be amused too . And now ? [They]738-our had been constantly together for many months : [he]736-he who had never cared before for companionship , had found [himself]736-he turning more and more to [her]740-good little old housemother . And now [he]736-he was going to lose [her]740-good little old housemother . [He]736-he looked up once or twice to make sure that [she]740-good little old housemother was still by [his]736-he side : [she]740-good little old housemother sat there so quietly . At last [he]736-he spoke in [his]736-he usual gruff way . "[740-good little old housemother] Have [you]741-you exhausted all [your]741-you eloquence in [your]741-you oration about [learned women]742-learned women ? " [he]736-he asked . "[741-you] No , [I]0-i am reserving it for a better audience , " [she]740-good little old housemother answered , trying to be bright . But [she]740-good little old housemother was not bright . "[0-i] [I]0-i believe [you]741-you came out to [the country]391-the country to day to seek for cheerfulness , " [he]736-he said after a pause . "[741-you] Have [you]741-you found it ? " "[741-you] [I]0-i do not know , " [she]740-good little old housemother said . "[741-you] It takes [me]0-i some time to recover from shocks ; and [Mr. Reffold]48-mr. reffold 's death was a sorrow to [me]0-i . What do [you]0-i think about death ? Have [you]0-i any theories about life and death , and the bridge between them ? Could [you]0-i say anything to help one ? " "[0-i] Nothing , " [he]736-he answered . "[0-i] Who could ? And by what means ? " "[0-i] Has there been no value in philosophy , " [she]740-good little old housemother asked , "[0-i] and the meditations of [learnèd men]744-learnèd men ? " "[0-i] Philosophy ! " [he]736-he sneered . "[0-i] What has it done for [us]745-we ? It has taught [us]745-we some processes of the mind 's working ; taught [us]745-we a few wonderful things which interest [the few]746-the few ; but the centuries have come and gone , and the only thing which [the whole human race]747-the whole human race pants to know , remains unknown : [[our]745-we beloved ones]748-our beloved ones , shall [we]745-we meet [them]748-our beloved ones , and how ? — the great secret of [the universe]749-the universe . [We]745-we ask for bread , and [these philosophers]750-these philosophers give [us]745-we a stone . What help could come from [them]750-these philosophers : or from [any one]146-any one ? Death is simply one of the hard facts of life . " "[745-we] And the greatest evil , " [she]1447-she said . "[745-we] [We]745-we weave [our]745-we romances about [the next world]752-the next world , " [he]1447-she continued ; "[745-we] and [any one who has a fresh romance to relate]753-any one who has a fresh romance to relate , or [an old one dressed up in new language]754-an old one dressed up in new language , will be listened to , and welcomed . That helps [some people]135-some people for a little while ; and when the charm of the romance is over , then [they]135-some people are ready for another , perhaps more fantastic than the last . But the plot is always the same : [[our]745-we beloved ones]748-our beloved ones — shall [we]745-we meet [them]748-our beloved ones , and how ? Is n't it pitiful ? Why can not [we]745-we be more impersonal ? [These puny , petty minds of [ours]745-we]757-these puny , petty minds of ours ! When will [they]748-our beloved ones learn to expand ? " "[748-our beloved ones] Why should [we]745-we learn to be more impersonal ? " [she]0-i said . "[748-our beloved ones] There was a time when [I]0-i felt like that ; but now [I]0-i have learnt something better : that [we]745-we need not be ashamed of being human ; above all , of having the best of human instincts , love , and the passionate wish for its continuance , and the unceasing grief at its withdrawal . There is no indignity in this ; nor any trace of weakmindedness in [our]745-we restless craving to know about the Hereafter , and the possibilities of meeting again [those whom [we]745-we have lost here]758-those whom we have lost here . It is right , and natural , and lovely that it should be the most important question . [I]0-i know that many will say that there are weightier questions : [they]748-our beloved ones say so , but do [they]748-our beloved ones think so ? Do [we]745-we want to know first and foremost whether [we]745-we shall do [our]745-we work better elsewhere : whether [we]745-we shall be endowed with more wisdom : whether , as [poor Mr. Reffold]48-mr. reffold said , [we]745-we shall be glad to behave less like [curs]1100-curs , and more like [heroes]760-heroes ? These questions come in , but they can be put aside . The other question can never be put on one side . If that were to become possible , it would only be so because the human heart had lost the best part of [itself]761-itself , its own humanity . [We]745-we shall go on building [[our]745-we bridge]762-our bridge between life and death , each one for [himself]763-himself . When [we]745-we see that it is not strong enough , [we]745-we shall break it down and build another . [We]745-we shall watch [other people]150-other people building [[their]150-other people bridges]765-their bridges . [We]745-we shall imitate , or criticise , or condemn . But as time goes on , [we]745-we shall learn not to interfere , [we]745-we shall know that [one bridge]766-one bridge is probably as good as the other ; and that the greatest value of [them]767-them all has been in the building of [them]767-them . It does not matter what [we]745-we build , but build [we]745-we must : [you]768-you , and [I]0-i , and [every one]231-every one . " "[0-i] [I]0-i have long ceased to build [[my]0-i bridge]770-my bridge , " [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man said . "[0-i] It is an almost unconscious process , " [she]768-you said . "[0-i] Perhaps [you]0-i are still at work , or perhaps [you]0-i are resting . [MANY of [the guests]325-the guests in [the foreign quarter]1475-the foreign quarter]1473-many of the guests in the foreign quarter had made a start downwards into [the plains]1019-the plains ; and [the Kurhaus itself]1477-the kurhaus itself , though still well filled with [visitors]1478-visitors , was every week losing [some of [[its]1477-the kurhaus itself invalids]1480-its invalids]1479-some of its invalids . [The invalids]1278-the invalids , some of [them]1278-the invalids better and some of [them]1278-the invalids worse , had become impatient . And plans were being discussed , where formerly temperatures and coughs and general symptoms were the usual subjects of conversation ! [The caretakers]1282-the caretakers , too , were in a state of agitation ; [some few]1490-some few keenly anxious to be of to new pastures ; and [others , who had perhaps formed attachments]1491-others , who had perhaps formed attachments , an occurrence not unusual in [Petershof]2-petershof , were wishing to hold back time with both hands , and were therefore delighted that the weather , which had not yet broken up , gave no legitimate excuse for immediate departure .
