This cold - heartedness struck [Bernardine]31-bernardine more than once , and [she]31-bernardine spoke of it to [Robert Allitsen]40-robert allitsen . It was the day before [her]31-bernardine own departure , and [she]31-bernardine had gone down with [him]40-robert allitsen to [the restaurant]1152-the restaurant , and sat sipping [her]31-bernardine coffee , and making [her]31-bernardine complaint . "[504-the matron] Such indifference is astonishing , and it is sad too . [I]0-i can not understand it , " [she]31-bernardine said . "[0-i] That is because [you]0-i are [a goose]782-a goose , " [he]40-robert allitsen replied , pouring out some more coffee for [himself]40-robert allitsen , and as an after thought , for [her]31-bernardine too . "[0-i] [You]0-i pretend to know something about the human heart , and yet [you]0-i do not seem to grasp the fact that most of [us]783-we are very little interested in [other people]150-other people : [they]150-other people for [us]783-we and [we]783-we for [them]150-other people can spare only a small fraction of time and attention . [We]783-we may , perhaps , think to the contrary , believing that [we]783-we occupy an important position in [their]150-other people lives ; until one day , when [we]783-we are feeling most confident of [our]783-we value , [we]783-we see an unmistakable sign , given quite unconsciously by [[our]783-we friends]785-our friends , that [we]783-we are after all nothing to [them]150-other people : [we]783-we can be done without , put on one side , and forgotten when not present . Then , if [we]783-we are foolish , [we]783-we are wounded by this discovery , and [we]783-we draw back into [ourselves]783-we . But if [we]783-we are wise , [we]783-we draw back into [ourselves]783-we without being wounded : recognizing as fair and reasonable that [people]946-people can only have time and attention for [their]946-people immediate belongings . [Isolated persons]787-isolated persons have to learn this lesson sooner or later ; and the sooner [they]787-isolated persons do learn it , the better . " "[788-he] And [you]788-he , " [she]1511-she asked , "[788-he] [you]788-he have learnt this lesson ? " "[788-he] Long ago , " [he]788-he said decidedly . "[788-he] [You]788-he take a hard view of life , " [she]1511-she said . "[788-he] Life has not been very bright for [me]0-i , " [he]788-he answered . "[788-he] But [I]0-i own that [I]0-i have not cultivated [[my]0-i garden]789-my garden . And now it is too late : the weeds have sprung up everywhere . Once or twice [I]0-i have thought lately that [I]0-i would begin to clear away the weeds , but [I]0-i have not the courage now . And perhaps it does not matter much . " "[0-i] [I]0-i think it does matter , " [she]1511-she said gently . "[0-i] But [I]0-i am no better than [you]788-he , for [I]0-i have not cultivated [[my]0-i garden]789-my garden . " "[0-i] It would not be such a difficult business for [you]0-i as for [me]0-i , " [he]788-he said , smiling sadly . [They]791-they left [the restaurant]1152-the restaurant , and sauntered out together . "[0-i] And to - morrow [you]0-i will be gone , " [he]788-he said . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall miss [you]788-he , " [Bernardine]31-bernardine said . "[0-i] That is simply a question of time , " [he]788-he remarked . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall probably miss [you]0-i at first . But [we]791-they adjust [ourselves]791-they easily to altered circumstances : mercifully . A few days , a few weeks at most , and then that state of becoming accustomed , called by [pious folk]792-pious folk , resignation . " "[788-he] Then [you]788-he think that the every - day companionship , the every - day exchange of thoughts and ideas , counts for little or nothing ? " [she]31-bernardine asked . "[788-he] That is about the colour of it , " [he]788-he answered , in [his]788-he old gruff way . [She]31-bernardine thought of [his]788-he words when [she]31-bernardine was packing : the many pleasant hours were to count for nothing ; for nothing the little bits of fun , the little displays of temper and vexation , the snatches of serious talk , the contradictions , and all the petty details of six months ' close companionship . [He]788-he was not different from [the others who had parted from [her]31-bernardine so lightly]1513-the others who had parted from her so lightly . No wonder , then , that [he]788-he could sympathise with [them]1513-the others who had parted from her so lightly . That last night at [Petershof]2-petershof , [Bernardine]31-bernardine hardened [her]31-bernardine heart against [the Disagreeable Man]28-the disagreeable man . "[0-i] [I]0-i am glad [I]0-i am able to do so , " [she]31-bernardine said to [herself]31-bernardine . "[0-i] It makes it easier for [me]0-i to go . " Then the vision of [a forlorn figure]1514-a forlorn figure rose before [her]31-bernardine . And [the little hard heart]1515-the little hard heart softened at once . In the morning [they]1516-they breakfasted together as usual . There was scarcely any conversation between [them]1516-they . [He]788-he asked for [her]31-bernardine address , and [she]31-bernardine told [him]788-he that [she]31-bernardine was going back to [[her]31-bernardine uncle who kept the second - hand book- shop in [Stone Street]24-stone street]1517-her uncle who kept the second - hand book- shop in stone street . "[0-i] [I]0-i will send [you]0-i a guide - book from [the Tyrol]1497-the tyrol , " [he]788-he explained . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall be going [there]141-there in a week or two to see [[my]0-i mother]542-my mother . " "[0-i] [I]0-i hope [you]0-i will find [her]542-my mother in good health , " [she]31-bernardine said . Then it suddenly flashed across [her]31-bernardine mind what [he]788-he had told [her]31-bernardine about [his]788-he one great sacrifice for [[his]788-he mother]208-his mother 's sake . [She]31-bernardine looked up at [him]788-he , and [he]788-he met [her]31-bernardine glance without flinching . [He]788-he said good - bye to [her]31-bernardine at the foot of [the staircase]1163-the staircase . It was the first time [she]31-bernardine had ever shaken hands with [him]788-he . "[0-i] Good - bye , " [he]788-he said gently . "[0-i] Good luck to [you]0-i . " "[0-i] Good - bye , " [she]31-bernardine answered . [He]788-he went up [the stairs]193-the stairs , and turned round as though [he]788-he wished to say something more . But [he]788-he changed [his]788-he mind , and kept [his]788-he own counsel . An hour later [Bernardine]31-bernardine left [Petershof]2-petershof . Only [the concierge of [the Kurhaus]7-the kurhaus]1521-the concierge of the kurhaus saw [her]31-bernardine off at [the station]1407-the station . TWO days after [Bernardine]31-bernardine had left [Petershof]2-petershof , the snows began to melt . Nothing could be drearier than that process : nothing more desolate than the outlook . [The Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man sat in [[his]102-the disagreeable man bedroom]1349-his bedroom trying to read [Carpenter]91-carpenter 's Anatomy . It failed to hold [him]102-the disagreeable man . Then [he]102-the disagreeable man looked out of the window , and listened to the dripping of the icicles . At last [he]102-the disagreeable man took a pen , and wrote as follows : "[0-i] [LITTLE COMRADE]92-little comrade , [LITTLE PLAYMATE]796-little playmate . " "[92-little comrade] [I]0-i could not believe that [you]92-little comrade were really going . When [you]92-little comrade first said that [you]92-little comrade would soon be leaving , [I]0-i listened with unconcern , because it did not seem possible that the time could come when [we]797-we should not be together ; that the days would come and go , and that [I]0-i should not know how [you]92-little comrade were ; whether [you]92-little comrade were better , and more hopeful about [your]92-little comrade life and [your]92-little comrade work , or whether the old misery of indifference and ill - health was still clinging to [you]92-little comrade ; whether [your]92-little comrade voice was strong as of [one who had slept well and felt refreshed , or whether it was weak like that of one who had watched through the long night]798-one who had slept well and felt refreshed , or whether it was weak like that of one who had watched through the long night . " It did not seem possible that such a time could come . Many cruel things have happened to [me]799-my , as to scores of [others]939-others , but this is the most cruel of all . Against [my]799-my wish and against [my]799-my knowledge , [you]92-little comrade have crept into [my]799-my life as a necessity , and now [I]799-my have to give [you]92-little comrade up . [You]92-little comrade are better , [God]1526-god bless [you]92-little comrade , and [you]92-little comrade go back to a fuller life , and to carry on [your]92-little comrade work , and to put to account those talents which [no one]157-no one realises more than [I]799-my do ; and as for [myself]799-my , [God]44-god help [me]799-my , [I]799-my am left to wither away . "[799-my] [[You]799-my little one]800-you little one , [[you]799-my dear little one]801-you dear little one , [I]0-i never wished to love [you]799-my . [I]0-i had never loved [any one]146-any one , never drawn near to [any one]146-any one . [I]0-i have lived lonely all [my]0-i young life ; for [I]0-i am only [a young man]804-a young man yet . [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i time after time : ' [I]0-i will not love [her]805-her . It will not do [me]0-i any good , nor [her]805-her any good . ' And then in [my]0-i state of health , what right had [I]0-i to think of marriage , and making a home for [myself]0-i ? Of course that was out of the question . And then [I]0-i thought , that because [I]0-i was [a doomed man]806-a doomed man , cut off from the pleasures which make a lovely thing of life , it did not follow that [I]0-i might not love [you]807-you in [my]0-i own quiet way , hugging [my]0-i secret to [myself]0-i , until the love became all the greater because it was [my]0-i secret . [I]0-i reasoned about it too : it could not harm [you]807-you that [I]0-i loved [you]807-you . [No one]157-no one could be the worse for being loved . So little by little [I]0-i yielded [myself]0-i this luxury ; and [my]0-i heart once so dried up , began to flower again ; yes , [little one]809-little one , [you]807-you will smile when [I]0-i tell [you]807-you that [my]0-i heart broke out into flower . " When [I]810-i think of it all now , [I]810-i am not sorry that [I]810-i let [myself]810-i go . At least [I]810-i have learnt what [I]810-i knew nothing of before : now [I]810-i understand what [people]946-people mean when [they]946-people say that love adds a dignity to life which nothing else can give . That dignity is [mine]0-i now , nothing can take it from [me]810-i ; it is [my]810-i own . [You]807-you are [my]810-i very own ; [I]810-i love everything about [you]807-you . From the beginning [I]810-i recognized that [you]807-you were clever and capable . Though [I]810-i often made fun of what [you]807-you said , that was simply a way [I]810-i had ; and when [I]810-i saw [you]807-you did not mind , [I]810-i continued in that way , hoping always to vex [you]807-you ; [your]807-you good temper provoked [me]810-i , because [I]810-i knew that [you]807-you made allowances for [me]810-i being [a Petershof invalid]1529-a petershof invalid . [You]807-you would never have suffered [a strong man]1530-a strong man to criticize [you]807-you as [I]810-i did ; [you]807-you would have flown at [him]1530-a strong man , for [you]807-you are [a feverish little child]1531-a feverish little child : not a quiet woolly lamb . At first [I]810-i was wild that [you]807-you should make allowances for [me]810-i . And then [I]810-i gave in , as [weak men]1532-weak men are obliged . When [you]807-you came , [I]810-i saw that [your]807-you troubles and sufferings would make [you]807-you bitter . Do [you]807-you know who helped to cure [you]807-you ? It was [I.]810-i [I]810-i have seen that often before . That is the one little bit of good [I]810-i have done in [the world]203-the world : [I]810-i have helped to cure cynicism . [You]807-you were shocked at the things [I]810-i said , and [you]807-you were saved . [I]810-i did not save [you]807-you intentionally , so [I]810-i am not posing as [a philanthropist]1534-a philanthropist . [I]810-i merely mention that [you]807-you came here hard , and [you]807-you went back tender . That was partly because [you]807-you have lived in [the City of Suffering]1535-the city of suffering . [Some people]135-some people live [there]141-there and learn nothing . But [you]807-you would learn to feel only too much . [I]810-i wish that [your]807-you capacity for feeling were less ; but then [you]807-you would not be [yourself]807-you , [your]807-you present self [I]810-i mean , for [you]807-you have changed even since [I]810-i have known [you]807-you . Every week [you]807-you seemed to become more gentle . [You]807-you thought [me]810-i rough and gruff at parting , [little comrade]1538-little comrade : [I]810-i meant to be so . If [you]807-you had only known , there was a whole world of tenderness for [you]807-you in [my]810-i heart . [I]810-i could not trust [myself]810-i to be tender to [you]807-you ; [you]807-you would have guessed [my]810-i secret . And [I]810-i wanted [you]807-you to go away undisturbed . [You]807-you do not feel things lightly , and it was best for [you]807-you that [you]807-you should harden [your]807-you heart against [me]810-i . "[810-i] If [you]810-i could harden [your]810-i heart against [me]0-i . But [I]0-i am not sure about that . [I]0-i believe that . . . . Ah , well , [I]0-i 'm [a foolish fellow]811-a foolish fellow ; but some day , [dear]654-dear , [I]0-i 'll tell [you]654-dear what [I]0-i think . . . . [I]0-i have treasured many of [your]654-dear sayings in [my]0-i memory . [I]0-i can never be as though [I]0-i had never known [you]654-dear . Many of [your]654-dear words [I]0-i have repeated to [myself]0-i afterwards until they seemed to represent [my]0-i own thoughts . [I]0-i specially remember what [you]654-dear said about [God]44-god having made [us]813-us lonely , so that [we]813-us might be obliged to turn to [him]44-god . For [we]813-us are all lonely , though some of [us]813-us not quite so much as [others]939-others . [You]654-dear [yourself]654-dear spoke often of being lonely . Oh , [[my]0-i own little one]815-my own little one ! [Your]654-dear loneliness is nothing compared to [mine]0-i . How often [I]0-i could have told [you]654-dear that . " [I]0-i have never seen any of [your]654-dear work , but [I]0-i think [you]654-dear have now something to say to [others]939-others , and that [you]654-dear will say it well . And if [you]654-dear have the courage to be simple when it comes to the point , [you]654-dear will succeed . And [I]0-i believe [you]654-dear will have the courage , [I]0-i believe everything of [you]654-dear . "[0-i] But whatever [you]654-dear do or do not , [you]654-dear will always be the same to [me]0-i : [[my]0-i own little one]815-my own little one , [my]0-i very own . [I]0-i have been waiting all [my]0-i life for [you]654-dear ; and [I]0-i have given [you]654-dear [my]0-i heart entire . If [you]654-dear only knew that , [you]654-dear could not call [yourself]654-dear lonely any more . If [any one]146-any one was ever loved , it is [you]654-dear , [dear heart]818-dear heart . " Do [you]654-dear remember how [those peasants at [the Gasthaus]13-the gasthaus]1540-those peasants at the gasthaus thought [we]1541-we were betrothed ? [I]654-dear thought that might annoy [you]654-dear ; and though [I]654-dear was relieved at the time , still , later on , [I]654-dear wished [you]654-dear had been annoyed . That would have shown that [you]654-dear were not indifferent . From that time [my]654-dear love for [you]654-dear grew apace . [You]654-dear must not mind [me]654-dear telling [you]654-dear so often ; [I]654-dear must go on telling [you]654-dear . Just think , [dear]654-dear , this is the first love - letter [I]654-dear have ever written : and every word of love is a whole world of love . [I]654-dear shall never call [my]654-dear life a failure now . [I]654-dear may have failed in everything else , but not in loving . Oh , [little one]809-little one , it ca n't be that [I]654-dear am not to be with [you]654-dear , and not to have [you]654-dear for [my]654-dear own ! And yet how can that be ? It is not [I]654-dear who may hold [you]654-dear in [my]654-dear arms . [Some strong man]1544-some strong man must love and wrap [you]654-dear round with tenderness and softness . [[You]654-dear little independent child]1545-you little independent child , in spite of all [your]654-dear wonderful views and theories , [you]654-dear will soon be glad to lean on [some one]158-some one for comfort and sympathy . And then perhaps that troubled little spirit of [yours]654-dear may find its rest . Would to [God]44-god [I]654-dear were [that strong man]1547-that strong man ! "[654-dear] But because [I]0-i love [you]819-you , [[my]0-i own little darling]820-my own little darling , [I]0-i will not spoil [your]819-you life . [I]0-i wo n't ask [you]819-you to give [me]0-i even one thought . But if [I]0-i believed that it were of any good to say a prayer , [I]0-i should pray that [you]819-you may soon find [that strong man]1547-that strong man ; for it is not well for any of [us]822-us to stand alone . There comes a time when the loneliness is more than [we]822-us can bear . " There is one thing [I]819-you want [you]819-you to know : indeed [I]819-you am not [the gruff fellow [I]819-you have so often seemed]1548-the gruff fellow i have so often seemed . Do believe that . Do [you]819-you remember how [I]819-you told [you]819-you that [I]819-you dreamed of losing [you]819-you ? And now the dream has come true . [I]819-you am always looking for [you]819-you , and can not find [you]819-you . "[819-you] [You]819-you have been very good to [me]0-i ; so patient , and genial , and frank . [No one]157-no one before has ever been so good . Even if [I]0-i did not love [you]819-you , [I]0-i should say that . " But [I]102-the disagreeable man do love [you]819-you , [no one]157-no one can take that from [me]102-the disagreeable man : it is [my]102-the disagreeable man own dignity , the crown of [my]102-the disagreeable man life . Such a poor life . . . no , no , [I]102-the disagreeable man wo n't say that now . [I]102-the disagreeable man can not pity [myself]102-the disagreeable man now . . . no , [I]102-the disagreeable man can not . . . . "[102-the disagreeable man] [The Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man stopped writing , and the pen dropped on the table . [He]102-the disagreeable man buried [his]102-the disagreeable man tear - stained face in [his]102-the disagreeable man hands . [He]102-the disagreeable man cried [his]102-the disagreeable man heart out , [this Disagreeable Man]1232-this disagreeable man . Then [he]102-the disagreeable man took the letter which [he]102-the disagreeable man had just been writing , and [he]102-the disagreeable man tore it into fragments . IT was now more than three weeks since [Bernardine]31-bernardine 's return to [London]3-london . [She]31-bernardine had gone back to [[her]31-bernardine old home]826-her old home , at [[[her]31-bernardine uncle]827-her uncle 's second - hand book - shop]828-her uncle 's second - hand book - shop . [She]31-bernardine spent [her]31-bernardine time in dusting the books , and arranging them in some kind of order ; for [old Zerviah Holme]30-zerviah holme had ceased to interest [himself]30-zerviah holme much in [his]30-zerviah holme belongings , and sat in [the little inner room]829-the little inner room reading as usual [Gibbon]29-gibbon 's " History of [Rome]4-rome . "[830-customers] [Customers]830-customers might please [themselves]830-customers about coming : [Zerviah Holme]30-zerviah holme had never cared about amassing money , and now [he]30-zerviah holme cared even less than before . A frugal breakfast , a frugal dinner , a box full of snuff , and a shelf full of [Gibbon]29-gibbon were [the old man]272-the old man 's only requirements : an undemanding life , and therefore a loveless one ; since the less [we]832-we ask for , the less [we]832-we get . When [Malvina]32-malvina [[his]272-the old man wife]120-his wife died , [people]946-people said : " [He]272-the old man will miss [her]120-his wife . "[946-people] But [he]272-the old man did not seem to miss [her]120-his wife : [he]272-the old man took [his]272-the old man breakfast , [his]272-the old man pinch of snuff , [his]272-the old man Gibbon , in precisely the same way as before , and in the same quantities . When [Bernardine]31-bernardine first fell ill , [people]946-people said : " [He]272-the old man will be sorry . [He]272-the old man is fond of [her]120-his wife in [his]272-the old man own queer way . "[946-people] But [he]272-the old man did not seem to be sorry . [He]272-the old man did not understand anything about illness . The thought of it worried [him]272-the old man ; so [he]272-the old man put it from [him]272-the old man . [He]272-the old man remembered vaguely that [[Bernardine]31-bernardine 's father]836-bernardine 's father had suddenly become ill , that [his]272-the old man powers had all failed [him]272-the old man , and that [he]272-the old man lingered on , just a wreck of humanity , and then died . That was twenty years ago . Then [he]272-the old man thought of [Bernardine]31-bernardine , and said to [himself]272-the old man , " History repeats itself . "[31-bernardine] That was all . Unkind ? No ; for when it was told [him]272-the old man that [she]31-bernardine must go away , [he]272-the old man looked at [her]31-bernardine wonderingly , and then went out . It was very rarely that [he]272-the old man went out . [He]272-the old man came back with fifty pounds . " When that is done , "[272-the old man] [he]272-the old man told [her]31-bernardine , " [I]272-the old man can find more . "[272-the old man] When [she]31-bernardine went away , [people]946-people said : " [He]272-the old man will be lonely . "[946-people] But [he]272-the old man did not seem to be lonely . [They]946-people asked [him]272-the old man once , and [he]272-the old man said : " [I]946-people always have [Gibbon]29-gibbon . "[946-people] And when [she]31-bernardine came back , [they]946-people said : " [He]272-the old man will be glad . "[946-people] But [her]31-bernardine return seemed to make no difference to [him]272-the old man . [He]272-the old man looked at [her]31-bernardine in [his]272-the old man usual sightless manner , and asked [her]31-bernardine what [she]31-bernardine intended to do . " [I]31-bernardine shall dust the books , "[31-bernardine] [she]31-bernardine said . " Ah , [I]272-the old man dare say [they]946-people want it , "[272-the old man] [he]272-the old man remarked . " [I]31-bernardine shall get a little teaching to do , "[31-bernardine] [she]31-bernardine continued . " And [I]31-bernardine shall take care of [you]272-the old man . "[31-bernardine] " Ah , "[272-the old man] [he]272-the old man said vaguely . [He]272-the old man did not understand what [she]31-bernardine meant . [She]31-bernardine had never been very near to [him]272-the old man , and [he]272-the old man had never been very near to [her]31-bernardine . [He]272-the old man had taken but little notice of [her]31-bernardine comings and goings ; [she]31-bernardine had either never tried to win [his]272-the old man interest or had failed : probably the latter . Now [she]31-bernardine was going to take care of [him]272-the old man . This was [the home to which [Bernardine]31-bernardine had returned]838-the home to which bernardine had returned . [She]31-bernardine came back with many resolutions to help to make [his]272-the old man old age bright . [She]31-bernardine looked back now , and saw how little [she]31-bernardine had given of [herself]31-bernardine to [[her]31-bernardine aunt]839-her aunt and [[her]31-bernardine uncle]827-her uncle . [Aunt Malvina]32-malvina was dead , and [Bernardine]31-bernardine did not regret [her]31-bernardine . [Uncle Zerviah]33-zerviah was here still ; [she]31-bernardine would be tender with [him]272-the old man , and win [his]272-the old man affection . [She]31-bernardine thought [she]31-bernardine could not begin better than by looking after [his]272-the old man books . Each one was dusted carefully . [The dingy old shop]841-the dingy old shop was restored to cleanliness . [Bernardine]31-bernardine became interested in [her]31-bernardine task . " [I]31-bernardine will work up the business , "[31-bernardine] [she]31-bernardine thought . [She]31-bernardine did not care in the least about the books ; [she]31-bernardine never looked into them except to clean them ; but [she]31-bernardine was thankful to have the occupation at hand : something to help [her]31-bernardine over a difficult time . For the most trying part of an illness is when [we]842-we are ill no longer ; when there is no excuse for being idle and listless ; when , in fact , [we]842-we could work if [we]842-we would : then is the moment for [us]842-we to begin on anything which presents itself , until [we]842-we have the courage and the inclination to go back to [our]842-we own particular work : that which [we]842-we have longed to do , and about which [we]842-we now care nothing . So [Bernardine]31-bernardine dusted books and sometimes sold them . All the time [she]31-bernardine thought of [the Disagreeable Man]28-the disagreeable man . [She]31-bernardine missed [him]28-the disagreeable man in [her]31-bernardine life . [She]31-bernardine had never loved before , and [she]31-bernardine loved [him]28-the disagreeable man . [The forlorn figure]843-the forlorn figure rose before [her]31-bernardine , and [her]31-bernardine eyes filled with tears . Sometimes the tears fell on the books , and spotted them . Still , on the whole [she]31-bernardine was bright ; but [she]31-bernardine found things difficult . [She]31-bernardine had lost [her]31-bernardine old enthusiasms , and nothing yet had taken their place . [She]31-bernardine went back to [the circle of [[her]31-bernardine acquaintances]845-her acquaintances]844-the circle of her acquaintances , and found that [she]31-bernardine had slipped away from touch with [them]845-her acquaintances . Whilst [she]31-bernardine had been ill , [they]845-her acquaintances had been busily at work on matters social and educational and political . [She]31-bernardine thought [them]845-her acquaintances hard , [the women]846-the women especially : [they]846-the women thought [her]31-bernardine weak . [They]846-the women were disappointed in [her]31-bernardine ; [she]31-bernardine was now looking for the more human qualities in [them]846-the women , and [she]31-bernardine , too , was disappointed . " [You]31-bernardine have changed , "[846-the women] [they]846-the women said to [her]31-bernardine : " but then of course [you]31-bernardine have been ill , have n't [you]31-bernardine ? "[846-the women] With [these strong , active people]847-these strong , active people , to be ill and useless is a reproach . And [Bernardine]31-bernardine felt it as such . But [she]31-bernardine had changed , and [she]31-bernardine [herself]31-bernardine perceived it in many ways . It was not that [she]31-bernardine was necessarily better , but that [she]31-bernardine was different ; probably more human , and probably less self- confident . [She]31-bernardine had lived in a world of books , and [she]31-bernardine had burst through that bondage and come out into [a wider and a freer land]848-a wider and a freer land . New sorts of interests came into [her]31-bernardine life . What [she]31-bernardine had lost in strength , [she]31-bernardine had gained in tenderness . [Her]31-bernardine very manner was gentler , [her]31-bernardine mode of speech less assertive . At least , this was the criticism of [those who had liked [her]31-bernardine but little before [her]31-bernardine illness]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness . " [She]31-bernardine has learnt , "[849-those who had liked her but little before her illness] [they]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness said amongst [themselves]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness . And [they]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness were not [scholars]850-scholars . [They]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness knew . These , two or three of them , drew [her]31-bernardine nearer to [them]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness . [She]31-bernardine was alone there with [the old man]272-the old man , and , though better , needed care . [They]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness mothered [her]31-bernardine as well as [they]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness could , at first timidly , and then with that sweet despotism which is for [us]852-us all an easy yoke to bear . [They]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness were drawn to [her]31-bernardine as [they]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness had never been drawn before . [They]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness felt that [she]31-bernardine was no longer analysing [them]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness , weighing [them]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness in [her]31-bernardine intellectual balance , and finding [them]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness wanting ; so [they]849-those who had liked her but little before her illness were free with [her]31-bernardine now , and revealed to [her]31-bernardine qualities at which [she]31-bernardine had never guessed before . As the days went on , [Zerviah]33-zerviah began to notice that things were somehow different . [He]33-zerviah found some flowers near [his]33-zerviah table . [He]33-zerviah was reading about [Nero]93-nero at the time ; but [he]33-zerviah put aside [his]33-zerviah Gibbon , and fondled the flowers instead . [Bernardine]31-bernardine did not know that . One morning when [she]31-bernardine was out , [he]33-zerviah went into [the shop]183-the shop and saw a great change there . [Some one]158-some one had been busy at work . [The old man]272-the old man was pleased : [he]272-the old man loved [his]272-the old man books , though of late [he]272-the old man had neglected them . " [She]31-bernardine never used to take any interest in them , "[272-the old man] [he]272-the old man said to [himself]272-the old man . " [I]272-the old man wonder why [she]31-bernardine does now ? "[272-the old man] [He]33-zerviah began to count upon seeing [her]31-bernardine . When [she]31-bernardine came back from [her]31-bernardine outings , [he]33-zerviah was glad . But [she]31-bernardine did not know . If [he]33-zerviah had given any sign of welcome to [her]31-bernardine during those first difficult days , it would have been a great encouragement to [her]31-bernardine . [He]33-zerviah watched [her]31-bernardine feeding the sparrows . One day when [she]31-bernardine was not [there]141-there , [he]33-zerviah went and did the same . Another day when [she]31-bernardine had forgotten , [he]33-zerviah surprised [her]31-bernardine by reminding [her]31-bernardine . " [You]31-bernardine have forgotten to feed the sparrows , "[33-zerviah] [he]33-zerviah said . " [They]1550-they must be quite hungry . "[33-zerviah] That seemed to break the ice a little . The next morning when [she]31-bernardine was arranging some books in [the old shop]857-the old shop , [he]33-zerviah came in and watched [her]31-bernardine . " It is a comfort to have [you]31-bernardine , "[33-zerviah] [he]33-zerviah said . That was all [he]33-zerviah said , but [Bernardine]31-bernardine flushed with pleasure . " [I]31-bernardine wish [I]31-bernardine had been more to [you]33-zerviah all these years , "[31-bernardine] [she]31-bernardine said gently . [He]33-zerviah did not quite take that in : and returned hastily to [Gibbon]29-gibbon . Then [they]858-they began to stroll out together . [They]858-they had nothing to talk about : [he]33-zerviah was not interested in [the outside world]859-the outside world , and [she]31-bernardine was not interested in Roman History . But [they]858-they were trying to get nearer to [each other]167-each other : [they]858-they had lived years together , but [they]858-they had never advanced a step ; now [they]858-they were trying , [she]31-bernardine consciously , [he]33-zerviah unconsciously . But it was a slow process , and pathetic , as everything human is . " If [we]858-they could only find some subject which [we]858-they both liked , "[31-bernardine] [Bernardine]31-bernardine thought to [herself]31-bernardine . " That might knit [us]858-they together . "[31-bernardine] Well , [they]858-they found a subject ; though , perhaps , it was an unlikely one . The cart - horses : [those great , strong , patient toilers of [the road]181-the road]861-those great , strong , patient toilers of the road attracted [their]858-they attention , and after that no walk was without its pleasure or interest . [The brewers]863-the brewers ' horses were [the favourites]864-the favourites , though there were others , too , which met with [their]863-the brewers approval . [He]33-zerviah began to know and recognize [them]863-the brewers . [He]33-zerviah was almost like [a child]1031-a child in [his]33-zerviah newfound interest . On Whit Monday [they]858-they both went to the cart - horse parade in [Regent 's Park]25-regent 's park . [They]858-they talked about the enjoyment for days afterwards . " Next year , "[33-zerviah] [he]33-zerviah told [her]31-bernardine , " [we]858-they must subscribe to the fund , even if [we]858-they have to sell a book . "[33-zerviah] [He]33-zerviah did not like to sell [his]33-zerviah books : [he]33-zerviah parted with [them]866-them painfully , as [some people]135-some people part with [their]135-some people illusions . [Bernardine]31-bernardine bought a paper for [herself]31-bernardine every day ; but one evening [she]31-bernardine came in without one . [She]31-bernardine had been seeing after some teaching , and had without any difficulty succeeded in getting some temporary light work at [one of [the high schools]869-the high schools]868-one of the high schools . [She]31-bernardine forgot to buy [her]31-bernardine newspaper . [The old man]272-the old man noticed this . [He]272-the old man put on [his]272-the old man shabby felt hat , and went down [the street]871-the street , and brought in a copy of the Daily News . " [I]272-the old man do n't remember what [you]31-bernardine like , but will this do ? "[272-the old man] [he]272-the old man asked . [He]272-the old man was quite proud of [himself]272-the old man for showing [her]31-bernardine this attention , almost as proud as [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man , when [he]272-the old man did something kind and thoughtful . [Bernardine]31-bernardine thought of [him]272-the old man , and the tears came into [her]31-bernardine eyes at once . When did [she]31-bernardine not think of [him]272-the old man ? Then [she]31-bernardine glanced at the front sheet , and in the death column [her]31-bernardine eye rested on [his]272-the old man name : and [she]31-bernardine read that [[Robert Allitsen]40-robert allitsen 's mother]873-robert allitsen 's mother had passed away . So [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man had won [his]102-the disagreeable man freedom at last . [His]272-the old man words echoed back to [her]31-bernardine : " But [I]272-the old man know how to wait : if [I]272-the old man have not learnt anything else , [I]272-the old man have learnt how to wait . And some day [I]272-the old man shall be free . And then . . . . "[272-the old man] AFTER the announcement of [Mrs. Allitsen]94-mrs. allitsen 's death , [Bernardine]31-bernardine lived in a misery of suspense . Every day [she]31-bernardine scanned the obituary , fearing to find the record of another death , fearing and yet wishing to know . [The Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man had yearned for [his]102-the disagreeable man freedom these many years , and now [he]102-the disagreeable man was at liberty to do what [he]102-the disagreeable man chose with [his]102-the disagreeable man poor life . It was of no value to [him]102-the disagreeable man . Many a time [she]31-bernardine sat and shuddered . Many a time [she]31-bernardine began to write to [him]102-the disagreeable man . Then [she]31-bernardine remembered that after all [he]102-the disagreeable man had cared nothing for [her]31-bernardine companionship . [He]102-the disagreeable man would not wish to hear from [her]31-bernardine . And besides , what had [she]31-bernardine to say to [him]102-the disagreeable man ? A feeling of desolation came over [her]31-bernardine . It was not enough for [her]31-bernardine to take care of [the old man who was drawing nearer to [her]31-bernardine every day]876-the old man who was drawing nearer to her every day ; nor was it enough for [her]31-bernardine to dust the books , and serve any chance customers who might look in . In the midst of [her]31-bernardine trouble [she]31-bernardine remembered some of [her]31-bernardine old ambitions ; and [she]31-bernardine turned to [them]877-them for comfort as [we]878-we turn to [old friends]879-old friends . " [I]31-bernardine will try to begin [my]31-bernardine book , "[31-bernardine] [she]31-bernardine said to [herself]31-bernardine . " If [I]31-bernardine can only get interested in it , [I]31-bernardine shall forget [my]31-bernardine anxiety ! "[31-bernardine] But the love of [her]31-bernardine work had left [her]31-bernardine . [Bernardine]31-bernardine fretted . [She]31-bernardine sat in [the old bookshop]880-the old bookshop , [her]31-bernardine pen unused , [her]31-bernardine paper uncovered . [She]31-bernardine was very miserable . Then one evening when [she]31-bernardine was feeling that it was of no use trying to force [herself]31-bernardine to begin [her]31-bernardine book , [she]31-bernardine took [her]31-bernardine pen suddenly , and wrote the following prologue . [FAILURE]95-failure and [Success]96-success passed away from [Earth]156-earth , and found [themselves]882-themselves in [a Foreign Land]883-a foreign land . [Success]96-success still wore [her]96-success laurel - wreath which [she]96-success had won on [Earth]156-earth . There was a look of ease about [her]96-success whole appearance ; and there was a smile of pleasure and satisfaction on [her]96-success face , as though [she]96-success knew [she]96-success had done well and had deserved [her]96-success honours . [Failure]95-failure 's head was bowed : no laurel - wreath encircled it . [Her]96-success face was wan , and pain - engraven . [She]96-success had once been beautiful and hopeful , but [she]96-success had long since lost both hope and beauty . [They]882-themselves stood together , [these two]885-these two , waiting for an audience with [the Sovereign of [the Foreign Land]887-the foreign land]886-the sovereign of the foreign land . [An old grey - haired man]888-an old grey - haired man came to [them]882-themselves and asked [their]882-themselves names . " [I]96-success am [Success]1551-success , "[96-success] said [Success]96-success , advancing a step forward , and smiling at [him]888-an old grey - haired man , and pointing to [her]96-success laurel - wreath . [He]888-an old grey - haired man shook [his]888-an old grey - haired man head . " Ah , "[888-an old grey - haired man] [he]888-an old grey - haired man said , " do not be too confident . Very often things go by opposites in [this land]1552-this land . What [you]96-success call Success , [we]1553-we often call [Failure]95-failure ; what [you]96-success call Failure , [we]1553-we call [Success]96-success . Do [you]96-success see [those two men]1554-those two men waiting there ? [The one nearer to [us]1553-we]1555-the one nearer to us was thought to be [a good man in [[your]96-success world]1557-your world]1556-a good man in your world ; the other was generally accounted bad . But here [we]1553-we call [the bad man good]1558-the bad man good , and [the good man bad]1559-the good man bad . That seems strange to [you]96-success . Well then , look yonder . [You]96-success considered [that statesman]1560-that statesman to be sincere ; but [we]1553-we say [he]1560-that statesman was insincere . [We]1553-we chose as [[our]1553-we poet]1561-our poet - laureate [a man at whom [[your]96-success world]1557-your world scoffed]1562-a man at whom your world scoffed . Ay , and those flowers yonder : for [us]1553-we they have a fragrant charm ; [we]1553-we love to see them near [us]1553-we . But [you]96-success do not even take the trouble to pluck them from the hedges where they grow in rich profusion . So , [you]96-success see , what [we]1553-we value as a treasure , [you]96-success do not value at all . "[888-an old grey - haired man] Then [he]889-he turned to [Failure]95-failure . " And [your]95-failure name ? "[889-he] [he]889-he asked kindly , though indeed [he]889-he must have known it . " [I]95-failure am [Failure]95-failure , "[95-failure] [she]95-failure said sadly . [He]889-he took [her]95-failure by the hand . " Come , now , [Success]96-success , "[889-he] [he]889-he said to [her]95-failure : " let [me]889-he lead [you]95-failure into [the Presence - Chamber]1564-the presence - chamber . "[889-he] Then [she]95-failure who had been called Failure , and was now called [Success]96-success , lifted up [her]95-failure bowed head , and raised [her]95-failure weary frame , and smiled at the music of [her]95-failure new name . And with that smile [she]95-failure regained [her]95-failure beauty and [her]95-failure hope . And hope having come back to [her]95-failure , all [her]95-failure strength returned . " But what of [her]95-failure , "[95-failure] [she]95-failure asked regretfully of [the old grey - haired man]890-the old grey - haired man ; " must [she]95-failure be left ? "[95-failure] " [She]95-failure will learn , "[272-the old man] [the old man]272-the old man whispered . " [She]95-failure is learning already . Come , now : [we]1565-we must not linger . "[272-the old man] So [she]95-failure of the new name passed into [the Presence - Chamber]1564-the presence - chamber . But [the Sovereign]893-the sovereign said : " [The world]203-the world needs [you]95-failure , [dear and honoured worker]1567-dear and honoured worker . [You]95-failure know [your]95-failure real name : do not heed what [the world]203-the world may call [you]95-failure . Go back and work , but take with [you]95-failure this time unconquerable hope . "[893-the sovereign] So [she]95-failure went back and worked , taking with [her]95-failure unconquerable hope , and the sweet remembrance of [the Sovereign]97-the sovereign 's words , and the gracious music of [her]95-failure Real Name . THE morning after [Bernardine]31-bernardine began [her]31-bernardine book , [she]31-bernardine and [old Zerviah]33-zerviah were sitting together in [the shop]183-the shop . [He]33-zerviah had come from [the little inner room where [he]33-zerviah had been reading [Gibbon]29-gibbon for the last two hours]895-the little inner room where he had been reading gibbon for the last two hours . [He]33-zerviah still held the volume in [his]33-zerviah hand ; but [he]33-zerviah did not continue reading , [he]33-zerviah watched [her]31-bernardine arranging the pages of a dilapidated book . Suddenly [she]31-bernardine looked up from [her]31-bernardine work . " [Uncle Zerviah]33-zerviah , "[31-bernardine] [she]31-bernardine said brusquely , " [you]33-zerviah have lived through a long life , and must have passed through many different experiences . Was there ever a time when [you]33-zerviah cared for [people]946-people rather than books ? "[31-bernardine] " Yes , "[33-zerviah] [he]33-zerviah answered a little uneasily . [He]33-zerviah was not accustomed to have questions asked of [him]33-zerviah . " Tell [me]31-bernardine about it , "[31-bernardine] [she]31-bernardine said . " It was long ago , "[33-zerviah] [he]33-zerviah said half dreamily , " long before [I]33-zerviah married [Malvina]32-malvina . And [she]32-malvina died . That was all . "[33-zerviah] " That was all , "[31-bernardine] repeated [Bernardine]31-bernardine , looking at [him]33-zerviah wonderingly . Then [she]31-bernardine drew nearer to [him]33-zerviah . It was all very quietly told , in a simple and dignified manner : nevertheless , for all that , it was an unburdening of [her]31-bernardine heart ; [[her]31-bernardine listener]897-her listener being [an old scholar who had almost forgotten the very name of love]898-an old scholar who had almost forgotten the very name of love . [She]31-bernardine was still talking , and [he]33-zerviah was still listening , when [the shop]183-the shop door creaked . "[33-zerviah] " And [I]31-bernardine have begun [my]31-bernardine book , "[31-bernardine] [she]31-bernardine said , pointing to a few sheets lying on the counter : that is to say , [I]0-i have written the Prologue . " "[31-bernardine] Then the dusting of the books has not sufficed ? " [he]33-zerviah said , scanning [her]31-bernardine curiously . "[31-bernardine] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could have seen . " "[31-bernardine] So [you]0-i will , " [she]0-i said . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall finish it , and [you]0-i will read it in [Petershof]2-petershof . " "[0-i] For the same reason that [you]0-i went [there]141-there eight years ago , " [she]0-i said . "[0-i] [I]0-i went [there]141-there for [[my]0-i mother]542-my mother 's sake , " [he]33-zerviah said . "[0-i] Then [you]0-i will go [there]141-there now for [my]0-i sake , " [she]0-i said deliberately . [He]33-zerviah looked up quickly . "[0-i] [Little Bernardine]98-bernardine , " [he]33-zerviah cried , "[0-i] [[my]0-i Little [Bernardine]98-bernardine]906-my little bernardine — is it possible that [you]98-bernardine care what becomes of [me]0-i ? " [She]0-i had been leaning against the counter , and now [she]0-i raised [herself]0-i , and stood erect , [a proud , dignified little figure]1579-a proud , dignified little figure . "[98-bernardine] Yes , [I]0-i do care , " [she]0-i said simply , and with true earnestness . "[0-i] [I]0-i care with all [my]0-i heart . And even if [I]0-i did not care , [you]907-he know [you]907-he would not be free . [No one]157-no one is free . [You]907-he know that better than [I]0-i do . [We]909-we do not belong to [ourselves]909-we : there are [countless people depending on [us]909-we]910-countless people depending on us , [people whom [we]909-we have never seen , and whom [we]909-we never shall see]911-people whom we have never seen , and whom we never shall see . What [we]909-we do , decides what [they]911-people whom we have never seen , and whom we never shall see will be . " [He]907-he still did not speak . "[0-i] But it is not for those others that [I]0-i plead , " [she]0-i continued . "[0-i] [I]0-i plead for [myself]0-i . [I]0-i ca n't spare [you]907-he , indeed , indeed [I]0-i ca n't spare [you]907-he ! . . . " [Her]0-i voice trembled , but [she]0-i went on bravely : "[0-i] So [you]907-he will go back to [the mountains]912-the mountains , " [she]0-i said . "[907-he] [You]907-he will live out [your]907-he life like [a man]913-a man . [Others]939-others may prove [themselves]939-others [cowards]915-cowards , but [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man has a better part to play . " [He]907-he still did not speak . Was it that [he]907-he could not trust [himself]907-he to words ? But in that brief time , the thoughts which passed through [his]907-he mind were such as to overwhelm [him]907-he . A picture rose up before [him]907-he : a picture of [a man]913-a man and [woman]721-woman leading [their]1582-their lives together , [each happy in the other]1583-each happy in the other 's love ; not a love born of fancy , but a love based on comradeship and true understanding of the soul . The picture faded , and [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man raised [his]907-he eyes and looked at [the little figure standing near [him]907-he]1585-the little figure standing near him . "[102-the disagreeable man] [Little child]917-little child , [little child]917-little child , " [he]907-he said wearily , "[917-little child] since it is [your]917-little child wish , [I]0-i will go back to [the mountains]912-the mountains . " Then [he]907-he bent over the counter , and put [his]907-he hand on [hers]917-little child . "[0-i] [I]0-i will come and see [you]917-little child to - morrow , " [he]907-he said . "[0-i] [I]0-i think there are one or two things [I]0-i want to say to [you]917-little child . " The next moment [he]907-he was gone . In the afternoon of that same day [Bernardine]98-bernardine went to [the City]1586-the city . [She]98-bernardine was not unhappy : [she]98-bernardine had been making plans for [herself]98-bernardine . [She]98-bernardine would work hard , and fill [her]98-bernardine life as full as possible . There should be no room for unhealthy thought . [She]98-bernardine would go and spend [her]98-bernardine holidays in [Petershof]2-petershof . There would be pleasure in that for [him]907-he and for [her]98-bernardine . [She]98-bernardine would tell [him]907-he so to - morrow . [She]98-bernardine knew [he]907-he would be glad . "[0-i] Above all , " [she]98-bernardine said to [herself]98-bernardine , "[0-i] there shall be no room for unhealthy thought . [I]0-i must cultivate [[my]0-i garden]789-my garden . " That was what [she]98-bernardine was thinking of at four in the afternoon : how [she]98-bernardine could best cultivate [[her]98-bernardine garden]1587-her garden . At five [she]98-bernardine was lying unconscious in [the accident - ward of [the New Hospital]1589-the new hospital]1588-the accident - ward of the new hospital : [she]98-bernardine had been knocked down by a waggon , and terribly injured . [She]98-bernardine will not recover , [the Doctor]498-the doctor said to [the nurse]351-the nurse . "[921-you] [You]921-you see [she]922-she is sinking rapidly . [Poor little thing]923-poor little thing ! " At six [she]98-bernardine regained consciousness , and opened [her]98-bernardine eyes . [The nurse]351-the nurse bent over [her]98-bernardine . Then [she]0-i whispered : "[102-the disagreeable man] Tell [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man how [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could have seen [him]102-the disagreeable man to - morrow . [We]925-we had so much to say to [each other]167-each other . And now . . . . " [The brown eyes]1593-the brown eyes looked at [the nurse]351-the nurse so entreatingly . It was a long time before [she]98-bernardine could forget the pathos of those brown eyes . A few minutes later , [she]98-bernardine made another sign as though [she]98-bernardine wished to speak . [Nurse Katharine]99-nurse katharine bent nearer . Then [she]99-nurse katharine whispered : "[28-the disagreeable man] Tell [the Disagreeable Man]28-the disagreeable man to go back to [the mountains]912-the mountains , and begin to build [[his]102-the disagreeable man bridge]928-his bridge : it must be strong and . . . . " [Bernardine]98-bernardine died . [ROBERT ALLITSEN]40-robert allitsen came to [the old book - shop]1595-the old book - shop to see [Zerviah Holme]30-zerviah holme before returning to [the mountains]912-the mountains . [He]40-robert allitsen found [him]40-robert allitsen reading [Gibbon]29-gibbon . [These two men]1597-these two men had stood by [[Bernardine]98-bernardine 's grave]1598-bernardine 's grave . "[0-i] [I]0-i was beginning to know [her]929-she , " [the old man]272-the old man said . "[0-i] [I]0-i have always known [her]929-she , " [the young man]1600-the young man said . "[929-she] [I]0-i can not remember a time when [she]929-she has not been part of [my]0-i life . " "[929-she] [She]929-she loved [you]0-i , " [Zerviah]33-zerviah said . "[929-she] [She]929-she was telling [me]0-i so the very morning when [you]0-i came . " Then , with a tenderness which was almost foreign to [him]33-zerviah , [Zerviah]33-zerviah told [Robert Allitsen]40-robert allitsen how [Bernardine]98-bernardine had opened [her]98-bernardine heart to [him]930-him . [She]98-bernardine had never loved [any one]146-any one before : but [she]98-bernardine had loved [the Disagreeable Man]28-the disagreeable man . "[929-she] [I]0-i did not love [him]930-him because [I]0-i was sorry for [him]930-him , " [she]0-i had said . "[0-i] [I]0-i loved [him]930-him for [himself]930-him . " Those were [her]0-i very words . "[0-i] Thank [you]0-i , " said [the Disagreeable Man]102-the disagreeable man . "[0-i] And [God]44-god bless [you]0-i for telling [me]0-i . " Then [he]102-the disagreeable man added : "[0-i] There were some few loose sheets of paper on the counter . [She]0-i had begun [her]0-i book . May [I]0-i have them ? " [Zerviah]33-zerviah placed them in [his]102-the disagreeable man hand . "[0-i] And this photograph , " [the old man]272-the old man said kindly . "[0-i] [I]0-i will spare it for [you]0-i . " The picture of [the little thin eager face]1604-the little thin eager face was folded up with the papers . [The two men]1605-the two men parted . [Zerviah Holme]30-zerviah holme went back to [his]30-zerviah holme Roman History . [The Disagreeable Man]28-the disagreeable man went back to [the mountains]912-the mountains : to live [his]28-the disagreeable man life out there , and to build [[his]28-the disagreeable man bridge]928-his bridge , as [we]931-we all do , whether consciously or unconsciously . If it breaks down , [we]931-we build it again . "[0-i] [We]931-we will build it stronger this time , " [we]931-we say to [ourselves]931-we . So [we]931-we begin once more . [We]931-we are very patient . And meanwhile the years pass .
